intro: Chamaesyce hillebrandii, commonly known as the Hillebrand's sand mat, is a low-growing flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Portulacaceae and is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers.
